What is the purpose of the OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag in Verus?
The OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag, with a value of 64, is used to restrict a PBaaS chain or gateway to a single currency.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What does the OPTION_GATEWAY flag do in Verus?
The OPTION_GATEWAY flag, with a value of 128, indicates that a currency routes external currencies.

a token, not a native currency
```

```
What does the OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag do in Verus?
The OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag, with a value of 512, indicates that a specific PBaaS gateway is the default converter and will publish prices.
```

What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag, with a value of 1024, controls whether top-level ID and currency registration happen on the launch chain or not. When this flag is not set on a gateway, registration happens on the launch chain.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What is an NFT token in Verus, and what does the OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag do?
In Verus, an NFT token is a single satoshi token that tokenizes control over the root ID. The OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag, with a value of 2048, is used to indicate that a token is an NFT token.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
